ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 9 Magnetic Field Sensor data at 1 min Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The magnetic field sensor, located at a few meters away from the spacecraft was designed to provide the orthogonal components of the magnetic field: Hp was parallel to the spin axis that was held nearly in the direction of Earth's axis, He was directed toward Earth center, and Hn pointed eastward. The magnetometer had a range of +/- 1000 nT (without saturation) and a resolution of 0.1 nT. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA-Office of Space Science Applications (United States); NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States); Dr. Howard J. Singer

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 9 magnetic field sensor data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 9 Magnetic Field Monitor data in CSV format as well as the magnetometer data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g08_magneto_1m_19950201_1995_02_28.csv, indicates goes 8 magnetometer data at 1 min resolution from Feb 1, 1995 to Feb 28, 1995.

TimeSpan.Note: Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags. Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: GOES 9 Magnetic Field Vector 1 min Resolution Data in Spacecraft Coordinates
Parameter.Description: Magnetic field vector for GOES 9 in spacecraft coordinates in units of nT. HP is parallel to the satellite spin axis, which is itself: perpendicular to the satellite's orbital plane. HE lies parallel: to the satellite-earth center line and points earthward. HN is: perpendicular to both HP and HE, and point eastward for GOES 9.
